title: Unify UI filter experience for all numerical filters

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: NewFeature
labels.description: Something to build that is a new item.

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
At the moment our amount filters use the following approach to mimic `total>X` and `total We actually already support "exact" dates via the `On` filter. So in this issue, we're going to do similar and make it easier to search for exact amounts for any numerical filter. More specifically, we will: - Update the `Amount`, `Total`, and `Purchase amount` filters (some currently being worked on). - Show `Equal to`, `Greater than` and `Less than` push rows - Make the input focused on the page, and only accept numerical values To keep things simple we won't yet add support for `Greater than or equal to` or `Less than or equal to`. We can re-evaluate this decision in the future.
Issue OwnerCurrent Issue Owner: @hungvu193

## Action Performed:
Break down in numbered steps

1. Have a workspace setup with max daily amount for expense
2. Scan a receipt that has amount over that allowed amount
3. Verify that once scanned the violation shows on the report preview on the workspace chat

Onyx state and data here:

https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C05LX9D6E07/p1756988912689619?thread_ts=1756736470.652199&cid=C05LX9D6E07

https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C05LX9D6E07/p1756814558482209?thread_ts=1756736470.652199&cid=C05LX9D6E07

## Expected Result:
Describe what you think should've happened

The transaction thread should show in the LHN with RBR

## Actual Result:
Describe what actually happened

The report is not showing in the LHN

## Workaround:
Can the user still use Expensify without this being fixed? Have you informed them of the workaround?

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.1-3 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** No **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/69638 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** djsdinjoijsdoinsj@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Mac 15.5 / Chrome **App Component:** Search ## Action Performed: 1. Go to staging.expensify.com 2. Go offline. 3. Go to Account > Troubleshoot. 4. Click Clear cache and restart > Reset and refresh. 5. Press CMD+K to open search router. 6. Close it. 7. Press CMD+K to open search router. ## Expected Result: In Step 5, offline indicator will appear on the search router the first time it is opened. In Step 7, offline indicator will not overlap with the skeleton loader. ## Actual Result: In Step 5, offline indicator does not appear on the search router the first time it is opened. labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!
___

**Version Number:** 9.2.1-3
**Reproducible in staging?:** Yes
**Reproducible in production?:** N/A - new feature, doesn't exist in prod
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/69441
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** ibellicotest+1717@gmail.com
**Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team
**Device used:** Motorola MotoG60 / Android 12 / Chrome ( mWeb / Hybrid app)
**App Component:** Search

## Action Performed:
Prerequisite: Account has at least one workspace available with delayed submissions enabled.
Prerequisite 2: No expenses created on account.
1. Open the Expensify app.
2. Open any workspace chat.
3. Create a manual expense.
4. Navigate to "Reports" > "Submit"
5. Open the just created expense.
6. Tap on "More" and delete the expense.
7. Return to "Reports" > "Submit"
8. Note that footer with expense details disappears.
9. Return to workspace chat.
10. Create a new manual expense.
11. Navigate to "Reports" > Submit" again.
12. Open the just created expense and delete it.
13. Reopen "Reports" > "Submit"
14. Note that empty state screen is displayed, but section footer still shows "1 expense" and the just deleted expense amount.
15. If step 14 not reproduced, repeat steps 9 to 13 one more time.

## Expected Result:
After deleting an expense on "Submit" section, footer should not display the just deleted expense details anymore.

## Actual Result:
When returning to "Submit" after deleting expense, section footer still shows "1 expense" and the just deleted expense amount.

## Workaround:
Unknown

4. Open account switcher.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** **Reproducible in staging?:** Needs Reproduction **Reproducible in production?:** Needs Reproduction **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @JmillsExpensify **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#expensify_quality](https://https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C05LX9D6E07/p1748013453884369) ## Action Performed: 1. Receive an attachment and view it in the web app 2. Switch to the mobile app and I limit the network speed to EDGE 3. The image doesn't load, it can't be downloaded (it shows the error that was sent above by Jason) 4. Restart the app (still on EDGE network) and it happens again 5. Switch the network speed to full and the thumbnail stays the same, but when I click on it, the image loads ## Expected Result: Image loads. ## Actual Result: Image broken and displayed error "Attachment not found" in chat. ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop

**App Component:** Chat Report View

## Action Performed:
Precondition: User B send message to User A
1. Open https://staging.new.expensify.com/
2. Go offline
3. User A, navigate to User B's convo
4. Right click on the message -> Flag as Offensive -> Harrassment
5. Navigate to LHN
6. Go online

## Expected Result:
LHN does not show the flagged message

## Actual Result:
LHN shows the flagged message again after back to to online.

## Workaround:
Unknown
